DCL OS Services: File System

Send comments on this topic.

Summary

DclOsFsBecomeFileUser   Allow this thread to access the file system.
DclOsFsDirClose   Close an open directory.
DclOsFsDirCreate   Create a directory.
DclOsFsDirGetWorking   Retrieve the current working directory.
DclOsFsDirOpen   Open a directory for reading.
DclOsFsDirRead   Read the next entry in a directory.
DclOsFsDirRemove   Remove a directory.
DclOsFsDirRename   Rename or move a directory.
DclOsFsDirRewind   Reset the position within an open directory.
DclOsFsDirSetWorking   Set the current working directory.
DclOsFsFileClose   Close an open file.
DclOsFsFileDelete   Delete a file.
DclOsFsFileEOF   Determine if the file pointer as at the end-of-file or not.
DclOsFsFileFlush   Flush any pending file data.
DclOsFsFileOpen   Open a file.
DclOsFsFileRead   Read data from a file.
DclOsFsFileRename   Rename or move a file.
DclOsFsFileSeek   Seek to a position in a file.
DclOsFsFileTell   Obtain the current position in a file.
DclOsFsFileWrite   Write data to a file.
DclOsFsReleaseFileUser   Indicate that this thread is finished accessing the file system.
DclOsFsStat   Retrieve information about a file or directory.
DclOsFsStatFs   Retrieve information about a file system.

DclOsFsBecomeFileUser

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsBecomeFileUser(void)
Allow this thread to access the file system.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.

DclOsFsDirClose

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirClose( DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir)
Close an open directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsDirOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirCreate

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirCreate( const char *pszPath)
Create a directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory to create.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirGetWorking

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirGetWorking(
    char *pszPath,
    unsigned nMaxPathLength)
Retrieve the current working directory.

Note -- If this functionality is not supported, this function must return an error code (without asserting). Higher level software may then use this function to detect whether CWD functionality is available or not and act appropriately.

Parameters

pszPath - A buffer to receive the current working directory.
uMaxPathLength - Size of buffer including the NULL terminator.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirOpen

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirOpen(
    const char *pszPath,
    DCLFSDIRHANDLE *phDir)
Open a directory for reading.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory.
phDir - Populated with a DCLFSDIRHANDLE used to access the directory.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirRead

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirRead(
    DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir,
    char *pszName,
    unsigned nMaxNameLength,
    DCLFSSTAT *pStat)
Read the next entry in a directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsDirOpen.
pszName - Populated with the next name in the directory.
uMaxNameLength - Size of pszName including the NULL terminator.
pStat - Populated with information about the entry. This can be NULL if the information is not desired.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirRemove

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirRemove( const char *pszPath)
Remove a directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory to remove.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirRename

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirRename(
    const char *pszOrigPath,
    const char *pszNewPath)
Rename or move a directory.

Parameters

pszOrigPath - The old path.
pszNewPath - The new path.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirRewind

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirRewind( DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir)
Reset the position within an open directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsDirOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsDirSetWorking

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsDirSetWorking( const char *pszPath)
Set the current working directory.

Note -- Some OS environments do not support the concept of a current working directory (CWD). The DclOsFsDirGetWorking function should be used to determine whether CWD functionality can be used or not. See the comments within that function.

Parameters

pszPath - The path of the directory to set as the CWD.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclOsFsFileClose

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileClose( DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile)
Close an open file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileDelete

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileDelete( const char *pszPath)
Delete a file.

Parameters

pszPath - The path of the file to delete.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.

DclOsFsFileEOF

int DclOsFsFileEOF( DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile)
Determine if the file pointer as at the end-of-file or not.

Compatibility Note -- Some documentation indicates that this function returns zero on the past the end-of-file. This behavior should not be depended upon.

For example if you seek to the end-of-file, and call this function it report end-of-file, even though by the previous definition it should NOT yet report end-of-file, because a read attempt has not yet been made. Therefore this behavior must not be depended upon.

Parameters

hFile - The DCLFSFILEHANDLE value

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileFlush

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileFlush( DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile)
Flush any pending file data.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileOpen

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileOpen(
    const char *pszFileName,
    const char *pszMode,
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE *phFile)
Open a file. This API can also be used to create or truncate files.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the file.
pszMode - The file open mode.
phFile - Populated with a DCLFSFILEHANDLE used to access the file.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileRead

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileRead(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    void *pBuffer,
    D_UINT32 ulSize,
    D_UINT32 *pulTransfered)
Read data from a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.
pBuffer - A pointer to the buffer to fill.
ulSize - Number of bytes to read.
pulTransfered - Populated with the number of bytes actually read.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileRename

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileRename(
    const char *pszOrigPath,
    const char *pszNewPath)
Rename or move a file.

Parameters

pszOrigPath - The old path.
pszNewPath - The new path.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.

DclOsFsFileSeek

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileSeek(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    D_INT32 lOffset,
    int iOrigin)
Seek to a position in a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.
lOffset - Relative file position.
iOrgin - Relative to what location in a file. DCLFSFILESEEK_SET, DCLFSFILESEEK_CUR, or DCLFSFILESEEK_END.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileTell

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileTell(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    D_UINT32 *pulPosition)
Obtain the current position in a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.
pulPosition - Populated with the current file position.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsFileWrite

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsFileWrite(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    const void *pBuffer,
    D_UINT32 ulSize,
    D_UINT32 *pulTransfered)
Write data to a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsFileOpen.
pBuffer - A pointer to the buffer from which to write.
ulSize - Number of bytes to write.
pulTransfered - Populated with the number of bytes actually written.

Return value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the operation result.

DclOsFsReleaseFileUser

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsReleaseFileUser(void)
Indicate that this thread is finished accessing the file system.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.

DclOsFsStat

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsStat(
    const char *pszName,
    DCLFSSTAT *pStat)
Retrieve information about a file or directory.

Parameters

pszName - The name of the object to get info about.
pStat - A buffer to receive the Stat information.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.

DclOsFsStatFs

DCLSTATUS DclOsFsStatFs(
    const char *pszPath,
    DCLFSSTATFS *pStatFs)
Retrieve information about a file system.

Parameters

pszPath - A path on the target file system.
pStatFs - A buffer to receive the StatFs information.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS code indicating the result.
